meanings.definition: The exclusion of employees by their employer from their place of work until certain terms are agreed upon.
meanings.sent1: During the lockouts, the workers were not allowed to enter the factory.
meanings.sent2: The lockouts at the office were due to a disagreement over wages.
meanings.sent3: The lockouts turned the workplace into a ghost town.
meanings.sent4: The lockouts acted as a barrier between the employees and their workplace.
meanings.sent5: The lockouts created a sense of isolation and uncertainty among the workers.

meanings.definition: The act of preventing access to a place or information by using a lock or other security measure.
meanings.sent1: The lockouts on the gate kept unauthorized people out of the building.
meanings.sent2: He experienced lockouts when he forgot his keys at home.
meanings.sent3: The lockouts on the diary prevented anyone from reading his secrets.
meanings.sent4: The lockouts on the computer files protected sensitive information from hackers.
meanings.sent5: The lockouts on the safe ensured the valuables inside were secure.
